member.summary: Adds a new separator to the end of the menu.

member.summary: Removes a specified context menu item at a given position within the menu

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IContextMenu.ClearAllItems
member.summary: Removes all items from the context menu, resulting in an empty menu.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IContextMenu.GetContextMenuItem(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a context menu item with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the menu item, as it is displayed within the menu. This applies only to items of type ContextMenuItemType.MenuItem
member.returns: A ContextMenuItem with the specified name, or null if no such item exists.
member.remarks: This method cannot be used to return separator menu items, as they cannot be uniquely identified.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AfterSendKeysEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the BeforeSendKey event to permit users to modify a key value or cancel a send key action before it is sent.

member.summary: AfterSendKeys event argument class.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AfterSendKeysEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs an AfterSendKeysEventArgs object.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AfterSendKeysEventArgs.Key
member.summary: Keys that have been sent.

member.summary: Cursor row position.

example.code: AfterSendKeysEventArgs args ; int row = ags.Row;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AfterSendKeysEventArgs.Column
member.summary: Cursor column position.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ColumnSeperatorOption
member.summary: Specifies valid character values to use as the column separator in 5250 terminal sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ColumnSeperatorOption.Dots
member.summary: Dots or periods (.) are used to render separate columns.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ColumnSeperatorOption.VerticalLines
member.summary: Vertical lines (|) are used to render separate columns.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400StatusLineOption
member.summary: Defines valid values that control rendering of the status line in 5250 terminal sessions.
member.remarks: These values specify which of three different host status lines appears at the bottom of the terminal window when you are connected to an AS/400.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400StatusLineOption.StatusLineNone
member.summary: Does not display the status line.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400StatusLineOption.StatusLine5250
member.summary: Displays a character-based representation of the status line.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400StatusLineOption.StatusLine3488
member.summary: Displays a symbol-based representation of the status line.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400StatusLineOption.StatusLineDebug
member.summary: Displays the debug status line.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400WordWrapOption
member.summary: Defines valid values for the 5250 word wrap feature.
member.remarks: These enumeration values specify whether to wrap text to the next available field or to truncate text at the end of the field, and whether the host controls this behavior.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400WordWrapOption.Off
member.summary: Text is not wrapped to the next available line, but is truncated at the end of the current line.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400WordWrapOption.Local
member.summary: Text is wrapped to the next available line as controlled by Reflection.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400WordWrapOption.Host
member.summary: Text is wrapped to the next available line as controlled by the host.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendControlKeyEventHandler
member.summary:
Handles the BeforeSendControlKey event to permit users to modify a control key value or cancel a send control key action before it is sent.
To cancel the action, set the Cancel property of the BeforeSendControlKeyEventArgs object passed to the event handler to true.

members.member:
Contains the Key and Cancel properties that allow the event handler to cancel the action or modify the key value before the control key is sent to the host.
[Serializable]

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendControlKeyEventArgs.#ctor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ControlKeyCode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a BeforeSendControlKeyArgs object.
member.param: To cancel the Control Key or not.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendControlKeyEventArgs.Key
member.summary: The Key property permits the user to inspect or modify the Control key value.

example.code: BeforeSendControlKeyEventArgs args; args.Key = ControlKeyCode.Delete;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendControlKeyEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: The Cancel property indicates whether the user wants to cancel the SendControlKey.

example.code: BeforeSendControlKeyEventArgs args; args.Cancel = true;

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendKeysEventHandler
member.summary: Handles the BeforeSendKeys event that permits users to modify a key value and cancel a send key action before it is sent.
member.remarks: To cancel the action, set the Cancel property of the BeforeSendKeysEventArgs object that's passed to the event handler to true.

members.member:
Contains the Cancel and Key properties that allow the event handler to cancel the action or modify the key value before the key is sent to the host.
[Serializable]

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendKeysEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a BeforeSendKeysEventArgs object.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendKeysEventArgs.Keys
member.summary: Gets or sets the Keys property that permits the user to inspect or modify the keys value.

example.code: BeforeSendKeysEventArgs args; args.Key = "Delete";

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendKeysEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cancel property that indicates whether the user wants to cancel the key action.
member.remarks: To cancel the Keys, set the Cancel property to true.

example.code: BeforeSendKeysEventArgs args; args.Cancel = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendKeysEventArgs.Row
member.summary: Gets the current row position of the cursor.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.BeforeSendKeysEventArgs.Column
member.summary: Gets the current column position of the cursor.

member.summary: Returns the current mapped foreground color for a given terminal attribute.

member.returns: The current foreground color mapping for the specified attribute.

member.summary: Returns the current mapped background color for a given terminal attribute.
member.remarks: Throws an exception when IsBackgroundSingleColor is false.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is returned.
member.returns: The current background color mapping for the specified attribute.

member.summary: Sets the current mapped foreground color for a given terminal attribute.
member.remarks: Throws an exception when IsBackgroundSingleColor is false.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is set.
The new foreground color mapping for the specified attribute.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeColor.SetBackgroundColor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IbmTerminalAttributeOption,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the current mapped background color for a given terminal attribute.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is set.
The new background color mapping for the specified attribute.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeColor.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object (ITheme).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeColor.IsBackgroundSingleColor
member.summary: Indicates whether the screen background color is a single color or mapped per field attributes defined in IbmTerminalAttributeOption enum.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeColor.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets text screen background color when IsBackgroundSingleColor is true.
member.remarks:
The get throws an exception when IsBackgroundSingleColor is false.
Setting text screen background color also sets IsBackgroundSingleColor property to true.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor.#ctor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeColor,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ITheme)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor.GetForegroundColor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IbmTerminalAttributeOption)
member.summary: Returns the current mapped foreground color for a given terminal attribute.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is returned.
member.returns: The current foreground color mapping for the specified attribute.
member.exception: Throws an exception when the ThemeColor object is null.

example.code: Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor color; Color foregroundColor = color.GetForegroundColor(IbmTerminalAttributeOption.GraphicsBlack);

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor.GetBackgroundColor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IbmTerminalAttributeOption)
member.summary: Returns the current mapped background color for a given terminal attribute.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is returned.
member.returns: The current background color mapping for the specified attribute.
member.exception: Throws an exception when the ThemeColor object is false.

example.code: Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor color; Color backgroundColor = color.GetBackgroundColor(IbmTerminalAttributeOption.GraphicsBlack);

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor.SetForegroundColor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IbmTerminalAttributeOption,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the current mapped foreground color for a given terminal attribute.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is set.
The new foreground color mapping for the specified attribute.
member.exception: Throws an exception when the ThemeColor is false.

example.code: Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor color; color.SetForegroundColor(IbmTerminalAttributeOption.GraphicsBlack,Color.blue);

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor.SetBackgroundColor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IbmTerminalAttributeOption,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets the current mapped background color for a given terminal attribute.
member.param: The host color or attribute whose mapped color is set.
The new background color mapping for the specified attribute.
member.exception: Throws an exception when the ThemeColor object is false.

example.code: Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeColor color; color.SetBackgroundColor(IbmTerminalAttributeOption.GraphicsBlack,Color.blue);

member.summary: Gets the parent object (ITheme).

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer
member.summary: Provides properties for configuring host file transfer and methods for executing file transfers to or from the host.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer
member.summary: Provides properties for configuring host file transfer, and methods for executing a file transfer to or from the host.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.INDReceiveFile(System.String,System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.INDFileTransferType,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileExistsOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transfers a file from the host to the PC using the IND$FILE protocol.
member.param: Specifies a name for the PC file to receive the host data. Include complete path information.
Specifies what type of file is being transferred.
Specifies what to do if the file specified in the pcFile argument already exists
Use true to display the Transfer in Progress window while the transfer is in progress, or false to not display the Transfer in Progress window.

remarks.para: If you're having trouble getting a transfer to work, make sure the XfrHostSys property is set to the appropriate value.

code.title: Receive File Transfer
code.description: This sample gets a file from the host. Before you run the sample, make sure the cursor is on a TSO command line.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.INDSendFile(System.String,System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.INDFileTransferType,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileExistsOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transfers a file from the PC to the host using the IND$FILE protocol.
member.param:
Specifies a local file. Provide complete path information or the file can be found only if it's in the current directory to be found.
You cannot use wildcard characters to send multiple files, as you can when you use the Transfer screen.
Specifies a name for the file being transferred. This name must comply with naming conventions for host files. You cannot use an empty string.
Specifies what type of file is being transferred.
Specifies what to do if the file specified in the HostFile argument already exists.
Use true to display the Transfer in Progress window while the transfer is in progress, or false to not display the Transfer in Progress window.
member.remarks: If you're having trouble getting a transfer to work, make sure the XfrHostSys property is set to the appropriate value.

code.title: Example
code.description: This sample sends a file to the host. Before you run the sample, make sure the cursor is on a TSO command line.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.ShowFileTransferDialog
member.summary: Opens the File Transfer dialog box.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.ShowFileTransferSetupDialog
member.summary: Opens the Transfer Setup dialog box. This method returns an error if the user cancels the dialog box.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.AbortTransfer
member.summary: Aborts an IND$FILE transfer. This method is more drastic than CancelTransfer and may leave the host session in an unpredictable state.
member.remarks: Use CancelTransfer unless you think the host program has stopped responding.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.CancelTransfer
member.summary: Cancels an IND$FILE transfer or an AS/400 data transfer in progress.
member.remarks: If the host has stopped responding, you may need to use the AbortTransfer method instead.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.AS400ReceiveFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transfers data from the host to the PC, using the AS/400 data transfer protocol.
member.remarks: This method is only relevant to 5250 sessions.
member.param: The name of a transfer request file that provides all necessary information about the transfer. Use an empty string if you are providing configuration information using AS/400 Data Transfer keywords.
Use true to display the Transfer in Progress window while the transfer is in progress, or false to not display the Transfer in Progress window.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.AS400SendFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transfers one or more PC files to the host, using the AS/400 data transfer protocol.
member.remarks: This method is only relevant to 5250 sessions.
member.param: The name of a transfer request file that provides all necessary information about the transfer. Use an empty string if you are providing configuration information using AS/400 Data Transfer keywords.
Use true to display the Transfer in Progress window while the transfer is in progress, or false to not display the Transfer in Progress window.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Open(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransferRequestType,System.String)

summary.para: Opens a transfer request file. This is equivalent to opening a Transfer Request (.mto or .xto) file using the Open button in the File Transfer dialog.

member.param: The transfer request file type: AS400 or Mainframe
The name of the transfer request file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object (IIbmTerminal).

members.member:
Returns or specifies a macro to be executed when you click the Show Host Files button in the Transfer dialog box.
You can use this macro to reposition the cursor or to go to a valid screen prior to executing the host file list command.
This property is only relevant for 3270 terminal sessions.
The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is null (or in Visual Basic is Nothing). Use an zero-length string to indicate an empty value.
/// Thrown if the set parameter length is too long.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.TransferType
member.summary: Returns or specifies the transfer protocol Reflection is to use.

item.description: Specifies IND$FILE as the transfer protocol. (The default for 3270.)
Specifies AS/400 data transfer as the transfer protocol. (The default for 5250.)
Specifies FTP as the transfer protocol.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.DfltExistsAction
member.summary: Returns or specifies during an IND$FILE transfer what happens when the destination file already exists.

remarks.para: This property only affects transfers done using the Transfer dialog box, since an "IfFileExists" option must be specified in transfer methods.

member.value: The default value (Overwrite) specifies to replace the destination file.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.ShowDISOSSStatusDialog
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether to display the transfer-in-progress "thermometer" when receiving data from the host during DISOSS transfers.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for 3270 sessions connecting to a host that uses DISOSS file transfer.
member.value: When this property is True, the thermometer is shown.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400AssumePositiveNumerics
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection looks for a negative sign or a blank (positive) in the first byte of numeric fields in fixed column ASCII database files.
member.remarks: This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 terminal sessions.

value.para: The default is False.
Change this value only if your database contains fields without leading negative signs or blanks.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400Authority
member.summary: Returns or specifies the level of authority to associate with a file that is transferred to the host.
member.remarks:
This property affects AS/400 data transfer.
Allows other users to see the file in a list, read it, write to it, or delete it.
Prevents other users from seeing the file in a list, writing to it, or deleting it.
Allows other users to see the file in a list and read it, but prevents them from writing to the file or deleting it.

value.para: The default value (ReadWrite) allows other users to see the file in a list, read it, and write to it, but not delete it.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400Charset
member.summary: Returns or specifies which character set to use for transfers to and from an AS/400.
member.remarks: This property is relevant for data that contains characters with decimal values above 127. (The ANSI and ASCII character sets have the same values for characters with decimal values from 32-126.) This property affects AS/400 data transfer.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400CompatibleAsciiFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection uses the buffer length or the field length of a packed decimal field to determine the size of fields on the PC.
member.remarks:
This mimics the way that Micro Focus RUMBA and EXTRA! perform this operation. When set to false, the extra byte in front of even length fields is eliminated.
This setting applies to 5250 sessions only.
member.value: The default value is False for all versons of Reflection except Japanese versions. (The default for Japanese versions of Reflecton is True.)
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400CompatibleFDFFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection denotes a number's digit/decimal characteristics in file description files the same as Micro Focus RUMBA.
member.remarks:
By default, Reflection counts the implied positive or negative sign and any decimal point when denoting the digit/decimal characteristics of a number in file description files. For example, Reflection denotes 123.45 as 7/2 (that is, seven total digits, two of which fall to the right of the decimal point).
The implied positive or negative sign represents the first digit, the numbers 123 represent the next three digits, the decimal point represents another digit, and the two numbers on the right of the decimal point (45) represent the last two digits.
RUMBA denotes the same number (123.45) as 5/2 (that is, five total digits, two of which fall to the right of the decimal point).
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400ExistsAction
member.summary: Returns or specifies what Reflection should do if it finds a PC file with the same name as the host file or member you are trying to receive.
member.remarks:
The equivalent property for IND$FILE is DfltExistsAction. This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions. Values:
AppendAppends the host file or member to the existing PC file.
AskUserPrompts the user for a decision if the PC file already exists. (The default.)
OpenErrorFails the transfer (and returns an error) if the PC file already exists.
OverwriteReplaces the existing PC file.
member.value: The default value is AskUser. This setting prompts the user for a decision if the PC file already exists.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400ForceHexConversion
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection translates data that is in coded character set ID (CCSID) 65535 from hexadecimal to EBCDIC when transferring it to the host or from hexadecimal to ANSI when receiving it from the host.

remarks.para: Columns tagged with the 65535 CCSID are designed not to be converted when transferring to and from the PC. This property keeps Reflection from converting CCSID 65535 data into character data and should be set to True only when it is not possible to change the column or file CCSID from 65535. Every attempt should be made to appropriately tag the data with the correct CCSID.
This property is applicable to 5250 sessions only.

value.para: The default value is True.

Use the default value (True) only if you are sure that the data contained within columns tagged with the 65535 CCSID are in a defined CCSID that matches the user profile CCSID of the jobs that will access it. Accessing 65535 CCSID data from job CCSID that does not match the data may corrupt the database file.
When this property is False, Reflection sends and receives data in hexadecimal format instead of translating it.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400LocalFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies the name of a PC file to send to an AS/400 (for file transfers to the host), or to receive data from an AS/400 (for data transfer from the host).
member.remarks:
When no path is given, Reflection uses the folder specified by XfrCurrentDirectory. For example, the following statements set the local transfer file to "C:\test\Payroll".
FileTransfer.XfrCurrentDirectory = "C:\Test"
FileTransfer.Xfr400LocalFile = "Payroll"
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions. When you are receiving data to a local file, the value of the Xfr400OutputDest property should be set to File (the default value).
The value of this property is not saved when you save a Reflection settings file, but is saved when you save a transfer request file.

value.para: The default is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.

member.remarks:
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions. Values:
AsciiAppropriate for files with no special formatting and fixed record widths. (The default.)
BasicSeqSeparates all fields with commas and inserts quotation marks around character and hexadecimal fields.
CommaDelimiterSeparates all fields with commas and inserts quotation marks around character fields that contain a comma or quotation mark.
DifUse for files transferred to and from Microsoft Excel. DIF files contain the names of the fields.
DosRandomAppropriate with host database applications that require data to be in this format.
NoConversionUse for files that should not be translated.
TabDelimiterSeparates all fields with tabs and inserts quotation marks around character fields that contain a quotation mark.

member.summary: Returns or specifies the reference file that contains the definitions of fields for the AS/400 being created.
member.remarks:
This property is only relevant when Xfr400Objects is set to CreateFileAndMember and Xfr400UseDescriptionFile is True. The syntax for specifying a reference file is:
[library name]/[filename]
The [library name] indicates the library in which the reference file resides. The [filename] is the name of the AS/400 database file that contains the field descriptions. For example:
FileTransfer.Xfr400RefFile = "mylib/myfile"
For more information on creating AS/400 files, see your AS/400 documentation. This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

member.summary: Gets or sets a sort sequence for the data being transferred. The specified sort sequence determines the order of characters in the alphabet when fields are alphabetized. s.
member.remarks:
The sort sequence also affects any comparisons based on characters in the fields. For example, the following statement specifies use of the EBCDIC hexadecimal sort sequence:
FileTransfer.Xfr400SortSeq = "*HEX"
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

value.para: The default is "*JOB". Possible values are:

item.description: Description
Uses the EBCDIC hexadecimal sort sequence.
Uses the AS/400 job default.
Uses a shared weight table.
Uses a unique weight table.

value.para:
You can also specify a table name. Use this syntax:
<library name>/<file name>
This string can be up to 220 characters long.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.Xfr400StartRecord
member.summary: Use this property to skip a given number of records at the start of a file before sending the file to the AS/400.

remarks.para: If you transfer a file to the AS/400 and then later attempt to transfer that same file to the AS/400 while specifying a start record greater than the number of records contained in it, the transfer will fail and the original file is preserved on the AS/400.
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

value.para: The range of values is 1-32768. The default is 1, which means the entire file is sent to the host. Specifying 2 means that the first record in the file will be skipped (not sent to the host), and so on.

For example, if you have an Excel spreadsheet that contains header information in the first line, you can skip this line before transferring this file. Changing this property from the default (1) is especially useful if this header information causes a problem for an AS/400 program that analyzes the uploaded data.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether shift-out and shift-in (SO/SI) characters in the host file are left intact (not translated). This property is used for JISCII file translations from the host with the NOSO option selected.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrAsciiCrlf
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether carriage returns and linefeed characters (CR/LF) at the end of lines in ASCII files are removed (when sent to the host) or added (when received from the host).
member.remarks: CR/LF processing is typically appropriate for ASCII files, but not for binary files. This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
member.value: The default (Convert) specifies that carriage return and line-feed characters are added or removed.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrBinaryCRLF
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether carriage returns and linefeed characters (CR/LF) at the end of lines in ASCII files are removed (when you send the file to the host) or added (when you receive the file from the host).
member.remarks: CR/LF processing is typically appropriate for ASCII files, but not for binary files. This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
member.value: The default value (Ignore) specifies that carriage return and line-feed characters are not added or removed.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

Returns or specifies the current local working folder for file transfer.
This folder is displayed by default in the Transfer dialog box and is used by default for opening and saving transfer request files. The value of this property changes if you navigate to a new folder using the Transfer dialog box.
The default is "". This string can be up to 220 characters long.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is null (Nothing in Visual Basic). Use an zero-length string to indicate an empty value.

members.member:
Returns or specifies the name of the host program to be run by Reflection to initiate a file transfer.
The default value, "IND$FILE", is generally appropriate for CMS and TSO hosts; for CICS hosts "IND$FILE" may be appropriate or you may need to specify your site's CICS transaction (for example, "CFTR"). This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
The default is "IND$FILE". (APVUFILE if you are running a Japanese version of Reflection.) This string can be up to 9 characters long.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is null (Nothing in Visual Basic). Use an zero-length string to indicate an empty value.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrIndAllocUnit
member.summary: Returns or specifies the unit of disk space for your primary and secondary space allocations.
member.remarks: This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable only to 3270 sessions when the host is running TSO. (This property is only relevant when the XfrHostSys property is set to Tso.)

value.para: The default specifies that the unit is determined by the host.
If you set the value to Block, use the XfrIndAvgBlk property to specify the size for an average block.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrIndAvgBlk
member.summary: Specifies the size (in bytes) for an average block.

remarks.para: This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable only to 3270 sessions when the host is running TSO.
This property is only relevant if the XfrHostSys property is set to Tso and if you are using blocks as your allocation unit (that is, if the XfrIndAllocUnit property is set to Block).

member.value: The default is 0. The range of values is 0-32768.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrIndBlkSize
member.summary: Returns or specifies the block size (in bytes) for the file being created on the host as the result of a transfer from Reflection.

remarks.para: For files with fixed-length records, this value must be a multiple of the Logical Record Length, which is controlled by the XfrIndLRecl property.
Reflection lets you set any value between 0 and 32768 to accommodate any range accepted by your host.
This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
This property is only relevant if the XfrHostSys property is set to Tso.

value.para: The default is 0. The range of values is 0-32768.

remarks.para: This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions when the host is running TSO or CMS.
This property is only relevant if the XfrHostSys property is set to Tso or Cms.

value.para: The default is 0. The range of values is 0-32768.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrIndSecAlloc
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of any additional allocations (in Allocation Units, as specified by the XfrIndAllocUnit) property in the event that the primary allocation is not sufficient.

remarks.para: Multiple secondary allocations (known as "extents") are allowed, up to a host-specified limit (generally 15). This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only. The default is 0. The range of values is 0-32768.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrIndSO
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether to convert shift-in (SI) characters to US (hex 1F) and shift-out (SO) characters to RS (hex 1E) in JISCII files received from the host.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrIndStrucFldSz
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection should use the Write Structured Field protocol for IND$FILE transfers and, if so, which size buffer to use.
member.remarks: This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.

value.para: For the English version, the default value (SF4K) uses the Write Structured Field protocol with a 4K buffer.
For the Japanese version, the default value (SF2K) uses the Write Structured Field protocol with a 2K buffer.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrJisciiCrlf
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether carriage returns and line-feed characters (CR/LF) at the end of lines in JISCII files are removed (from files you send to the host) or added (to files you receive from the host).

remarks.para: CR/LF processing is typically appropriate for JISCII files, but not for binary files.
This property is applicable to double-byte 3270 sessions only.
If you specify a value that is too large for your host, it will disconnect your session when you first attempt to send a file big enough to fill the buffer. Most systems support values up to 8K.

member.value: The default is Convert, which specifies that carriage return and line-feed characters are added and removed.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

members.member:
Returns or specifies a default PC file or files for the PC to receive (for transfers from the host), or for the host to receive (for transfers to the host).
When no path is given, Reflection uses the folder specified by XfrCurrentDirectory. Note: This property only affects file transfer done using the File Transfer dialog box. If you are transferring files programmatically using IndReceiveFile method or IndSendFile method, you must specify the local file name using the LocalFile argument.
Use commas to separate multiple file names, for example:
FileTransfer.XfrRemoteFile = "test1.txt, test2.txt"
This property affects IND$FILE data transfer and and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is null (Nothing in Visual Basic). Use an zero-length string to indicate an empty value.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

Use commas to separate multiple file names, for example:

member.summary: This property returns a numeric value which indicates success or failure by the transfer program after a transfer is completed.

item.description: The transfer was successful.
An error was detected by AS/400. Additional explanation is available in the XfrHostMessage property.
The command was cancelled.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrStartTimeout
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many seconds Reflection should wait for a host response when attempting to connect to a host.
member.remarks:
If the specified amount of time elapses with no response from the host, Reflection times out and returns an error. This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
The default is 25. The range of values is 1-9999.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrTimeout
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many seconds Reflection should wait for a host response before timing out and returning an error.
member.remarks:
(Most timeouts occur during file transfers, though this value is also used in other situations.) This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only.
The default is 60. The range of values is 1-9999.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a Reflection property that has been secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.
Thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IFileTransfer.XfrSpacesToUnderscores

summary.para: Gets or sets whether to translate spaces in a file name to underscores during a transfer to a mainframe or AS/400.

member.value: When this property is set to True (the default), spaces in PC file names are changed to underscores when sent to a mainframe or AS/400. For example, a PC file named "No way" is translated to "No_way" when sent to the host.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.INDReceiveFile(System.String,System.String,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.INDFileTransferType,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileExistsOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transfers a file from the host to the PC using the IND$FILE protocol.

member.summary: Transfers a file from the PC to the host using the IND$FILE protocol.
member.param: Specifies a local file. Unless you provide complete path information, only files in the current directory will be found. You cannot use wildcard characters to send multiple files the way you can by using the Transfer screen.
Specifies a name for the file being transferred. This name must comply with host file naming conventions. You cannot use an empty string.
Specifies the type of file being transferred.
Specifies what to do if the file specified in the HostFile argument already exists.
Use true to display the Transfer in the Progress window while the transfer is in progress, or false to not display the Transfer in the Progress window.
member.exception: If the FileTransfer object equals Null.

example.code: FileTransfer file = new FileTransfer(IFileTransfer fileTransfer,IIbmTerminal ibmTerminal); file.INDSendFile("//pcFile.txt", "HostFile", INDFileTransferType.Ascii, FileExistsOption.AskUser, true);

member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection looks for a negative sign (-) or a blank (positive) in the first byte of numeric fields in fixed column ASCII database files.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400Authority
member.summary: Returns or specifies the level of authority to associate with a file that is transferred to the host.
member.remarks:
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant when the SessionType property is set to 5250Terminal.
Values:
AuthAll Allows other users to view the file in a list, and to read it, write to it, or delete it.
AuthNone Prevents other users from viewing the file in a list, and from writing to it or deleting it.
AuthRead Allows other users to view the file in a list and read it, but not to write to the file or delete it.
AuthReadWrite Allows other users to see the file in a list, read it, and write to it, but not delete it. (The default.)
member.exception: This exception is thrown if you modify a Reflection property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400Charset
member.summary: Returns or specifies the character set to use for transfers to and from an AS/400.
member.remarks:
This property is relevant for data that contains characters with decimal values greater than 127. (The ANSI and ASCII character sets have the same values for characters with decimal values from 32 - 126.)
This property affects AS/400 data transfer only.
Values:
AS400Ansi Uses the ANSI character set. (The default.)

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400CompatibleAsciiFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection uses the buffer length or the field length of a packed decimal field to determine the size of fields on the PC.
member.remarks: This setting mimics how Micro Focus RUMBA and EXTRA! perform this same operation. When set to false, the extra byte that appears as a space in front of even length fields is eliminated. This setting applies to 5250 sessions only.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if you modify a Reflection property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400CompatibleFDFFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether Reflection denotes a number's digit/decimal characteristics in file description files (FDF) the same as RUMBA.
member.remarks:
By default, Reflection counts the implied positive or negative sign and any decimal point when denoting the digit/decimal characteristics of a number in file description files. For example, Reflection denotes 123.45 as 7/2 (that is, seven total digits, two of which fall to the right of the decimal point).
The implied positive or negative sign represents the first digit, the numbers 123 represent the next three digits, the decimal point represents another digit, and the two numbers on the right of the decimal point (45) represent the last two digits.
RUMBA denotes the same number (123.45) as 5/2 (that is, five total digits, two of which fall to the right of the decimal point).
member.exception: This exception is thrown if you modify a Reflection property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or if such a modification requires Administrator privileges.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400LocalFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies the name of the PC file to send or receive in AS/400 data transfers.
member.remarks:
If no path is provided, Reflection uses the folder specified by XfrCurrentDirectory. For example, the following statements set the local transfer file to "C:\test\Payroll":
FileTransfer.XfrCurrentDirectory = "C:\Test"
FileTransfer.Xfr400LocalFile = "Payroll"
When you receive data to a local file, the value of the Xfr400OutputDestination property should be set to AS400File (the default value).
This property is only relevant for 5250 sessions. The default is "". This string can contain up to 260 characters.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400SortSeq
member.summary: Returns or specifies a sort sequence for the transferred data.
member.remarks:
The sort sequence determines the order of alphabetic characters when fields are alphabetized. The sort sequence also affects any comparisons based on characters in the fields. For example, the following statement specifies the EBCDIC hexadecimal sort sequence:
FileTransfer.Xfr400SortSeq = "*HEX"
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.
Values:
*HEXUses the EBCDIC hexadecimal sort sequence.
*JOBUses the AS/400 job default.
*LANGIDSHRUses a shared weight table.
*LANGIDUNQUses a unique weight table.
You can also specify a table name by using the following syntax:
[library name]/[filename]
This string can contain up to 220 characters.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.Xfr400StartRecord
member.summary: Use this property to skip a given number of records at the start of a file (for example, the first line of headings in a spreadsheet) before sending the file to the AS/400.
member.remarks:
If header information causes a problem for an AS/400 program that analyzes the uploaded data, change this property from the default (1). The range of values is 1 - 32,768.
The value 1 sends the entire file to the host.
The value 2 skips the first record in the file.
The value 3 skips the first two records in the file (and so on).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.XfrAsciiCrlf
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether carriage returns and linefeed characters (CR/LF) at the end of lines in ASCII files are removed (when sent to the host) or added (when received from the host).
member.remarks:

Values:
ConvertCarriage return and linefeed characters are added or removed. (The default.)
IgnoreCarriage return and linefeed characters are not added or removed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.XfrHostCmd
member.summary: Returns or specifies the host program that Reflection runs to initiate a file transfer.
member.remarks:
The default value, "IND$FILE" (or "APVUFILE" if you use a Japanese version of Reflection) is generally appropriate for CMS, TSO, and CICS hosts.
For CICS hosts, you may need to specify your site's CICS transaction (for example, "CFTR"). This property affects IND$FILE transfer and is applicable to 3270 sessions only. This string can contain up to 9 characters.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.XfrLocalFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies the default file or files that the PC receives (for transfers from the host), or that the host receives (for transfers to the host).
member.remarks:
This property only affects IND$FILE data transfer in 3270 sessions using the File Transfer dialog box. If you transfer files programmatically using the IndReceiveFile or the IndSendFile method, you must specify the local filename using the LocalFile argument.When no path is given, Reflection uses the folder specified by XfrCurrentDirectory.
Use commas to separate multiple filenames, for example:
FileTransfer.XfrRemoteFile = "test1.txt, test2.txt"
The default value is "". This string can contain up to 260 characters.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.FileTransfer.XfrStartTimeout
member.summary: Returns or specifies the length of time (in seconds) Reflection waits for a host response when attempting to connect to a host.
member.remarks:

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.DefaultExistsActionOption.OpenError
member.summary: Fails the transfer and returns an error.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400AuthorityOption
member.summary: Specifies the authority level associated with a file that is transferred to the host.
member.remarks: This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400AuthorityOption.All
member.summary: Allows other users to view the file in a list, and to read, write to, or delete the file.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400AuthorityOption.None
member.summary: Prevents other users from viewing the file in a list, and from writing to or deleting the file.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400AuthorityOption.Read
member.summary: Allows other users to view the file in a list and to read it, but prevents them from writing to the file or deleting it.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400AuthorityOption.ReadWrite
member.summary: Allows other users to view the file in a list, and to read it and write to it, but not delete it.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400CharSetOption
member.summary: Specifies which character set to use for transfers to and from an AS/400.
member.remarks:
This property is relevant for data that contains characters with decimal values above 127. (The ANSI and ASCII character sets have the same values for characters with decimal values from 32-126.)
This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400CharSetOption.AS400Ansi
member.summary: ANSI character set.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400CharSetOption.AS400Ascii
member.summary: ASCII character set.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ObjectsOption
member.summary: Specifies whether to tranfer data to a new member on the AS/400 or to an existing member, and whether the file that contains the member already exists. (5250 sessions only.)

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ObjectsOption.CreateFileAndMember
member.summary: Creates a new member within a new host file.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ObjectsOption.CreateMember
member.summary: Creates a new member within an existing host file.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ObjectsOption.RepMemberConf
member.summary: Sends to an existing member in an existing file. Before overwriting the existing member, Reflection asks you to confirm the overwrite action.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ObjectsOption.RepMember
member.summary: Sends to an existing member in an existing file. Reflection does not prompt you to confirm the overwrite action before overwriting the existing member.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400OutputDestinationOption
member.summary: Specifies whether host data should be received to a PC file or to your display.
member.remarks: This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400OutputDestinationOption.Display
member.summary: Receives host data to your display.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400OutputDestinationOption.File
member.summary: Receives host data to the file specified by the Xfr400LocalFile property.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400OutputDestinationOption.Spreadsheet
member.summary: Receives host data to a DIF file.
member.remarks: If you have a spreadsheet program on your PC that has a Windows association with DIF files, selecting this option also opens the DIF file in that program.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption
member.summary: Specifies a conversion format for a file being received from an AS/400.
member.remarks: This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.Ascii
member.summary: Appropriate for files with no special formatting and fixed record widths.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.BasicSeq
member.summary: Separates all fields with commas and inserts quotation marks around character and hexadecimal fields.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.CommaDelimiter
member.summary: Separates fields with commas, but only inserts quotation marks around character fields that contain a comma or quotation mark.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.DosRandom
member.summary: Appropriate with host database applications that require data to be in this format.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.NoConversion
member.summary: Use for files that should not be translated.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.TabDelimiter
member.summary: Separates all fields with tabs and inserts quotation marks around character fields that contain a quotation mark.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400ReceiveConversionOption.Dif
member.summary: Use for files transferred to and from Microsoft Excel. DIF files contain the names of the fields.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption
member.summary: Specifies a conversion format for files received from an AS/400.
member.remarks: This property affects AS/400 data transfer and is only relevant for 5250 sessions.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption.Ascii
member.summary: Appropriate for files with fixed record widths and no special formatting.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption.BasicSeq
member.summary: Separates fields with commas and inserts quotation marks around character and hexadecimal fields.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption.CommaDelimiter
member.summary: Separates fields with commas and inserts quotation marks around character fields that contain either a comma or a quotation mark.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption.DosRandom
member.summary: Appropriate with host database applications that require data to be in this format.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption.NoConversion
member.summary: Use for files that should not be translated.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.AS400SendConversionOption.TabDelimiter
member.summary: Separates fields with tabs and inserts quotation marks around character fields that contain a quotation mark.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HostKeyboardTypeOption.Normal
member.summary: Only number keys (on the keyboard and the numeric keypad) and certain symbol keys (PLUS SIGN, MINUS SIGN, PERIOD, and COMMA) can be used.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HostKeyboardTypeOption.Typewriter
member.summary: Only SHIFT key combinations that produce uppercase letters and symbols (such as !, @, and #), and number keys on the keypad can be used.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HostKeyboardTypeOption.DataEntry
member.summary: All keys can be used.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots
member.summary: Hot spot object, defines the set of properties and methods related to hotspots.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots
member.summary: Defines methods to configure hotspots and properties to get and set hotspot visibility, position, and other attributes.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.ConfigureHotSpots(System.String)
member.summary: Load the hotspots file as the current hotspots definitions.
member.returns: Method return code

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the hotspots map, resulting in an empty map.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.AddHotspot(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Hotspot)
member.summary: Adds a new hotspot to the current hotspot map. If a hotspot with the specified text already exists, subject to the existing hotspot's case sensitivity property, it is removed prior to the new hotspot being added.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.RemoveHotspot(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Hotspot)
member.summary: Removes a hotspot with the specified characteristics from the currrent hotspot map.
member.remarks: Does nothing if no match is found.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.RemoveHotspotByText(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes all hotspots with the specified text from the currrent hotspot map.
member.param: Remove all hotspots with this text value
Whether to remove hotspots with the specified text, regardless of case
member.remarks: Does nothing if no match is found.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.Contains(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there is a hotspot with the specified text in the current hotspot map.
member.param: Whether to look for hotspots with the specified text, regardless of case
member.returns: True if there is a hotspot with the specified text in the current hotspot map, false if not

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.Save
member.summary: Saves changes to current hotspots map. If the current hotspots map (identified by the HotspotsMap property) resides in the installation directory and cannot be written to, the map is saved to the current user's Hotspots Maps subfolder underneath the Reflection folder, using the terminal session name as the hotspot map filename.
member.returns: One of the ReturnCode enumerated values, unless an exception has been thrown
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while trying to save the hotspots map.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the hotspots map.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves current hotspots map contents to a file.
member.param: The path to the new hotspots map file
member.returns: One of the ReturnCode enumerated values, unless an exception has been thrown.
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while trying to save the hotspots map.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the hotspots map.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.ApplyCurrentHotspots
member.summary: Sends and applies the current hotspot map contents to the host session.
member.returns: One of the ReturnCode enumeration values

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.HotspotsMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the current hotspots definition file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.MappingCollection
member.summary: Gets a set of all the hotspots that have been mapped in the current hotspot map.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IHotSpots.DefaultHotspotMapName
member.summary: Gets the path and filename that the Save method saves a hotspot to when the location defined by the HotspotsMap property is read-only.
member.remarks: The Save method saves the in-memory hotspot collection to the hotspot file defined by the HotspotsMap property. However, if that location points at a read-only location such as the built-ins folder underneath program files\attachmate\reflection where files cannot be written to, then the Save method saves the file in the user's documents area (e.g. Documents\Attachmate\Reflection\Hotspots Maps) under the name of the active session.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.MatchCase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether hotspots are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.SpaceDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the whitespace created by pressing the spacebar is to be used as a hotspots delimiter.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.UseOtherDelimiters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents of the OtherDelimiters property are to be used as additional hotspots delimiters.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.OtherDelimiters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating other character(s) to use as hotspot delimiters when the UseOtherDelimiters property is set to true.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.HotspotsMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the current hotspots definition file.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.MappingCollection
member.summary: Gets a set of all the hotspots that have been mapped in the current hotspot map.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.HotSpots.DefaultHotspotMapName
member.summary: Gets the path and filename that the Save method saves a hotspot to when the location defined by the HotspotsMap property is read-only.
member.remarks: The Save method saves the in-memory hotspot collection to the hotspot file defined by the HotspotsMap property. However, if that location points at a read-only location such as the built-ins folder underneath program files\attachmate\reflection where files cannot be written to, then the Save method saves the file in the user's documents area (e.g. Documents\Attachmate\Reflection\Hotspots Maps) under the name of the active session.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.LockInput
member.summary: Locks the screen so that users cannot use the keyboard to provide input.

Other means of input (such as, macros or the application programming interface) are still available.
To release the lock, use UnlockInput().

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.MoveCursor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the cursor forward or back.
member.param: The number of rows to move the cursor. The minimum and maximum values vary according to the number of rows supported by the terminal model Reflection is emulating.
The number of columns to move the cursor. The minimum and maximum values vary according to the number of columns supported by the terminal model Reflection is emulating.

remarks.para: Use the CursorRow and CursorColumn properties to verify the cursor location.

Both "rows" and "columns" arguments can be positive or negative numbers. Negative numbers move the cursor back toward smaller rows and columns. The resulting row and column position is bound by the screen's dimensions. Rows and columns do not wrap when they reach the maximum or minimum row or column values.
To move the cursor to a specific location, use the MoveCursorTo Method.

member.returns: ReturnCode indicates success, failure, or an error if the cursor position reaches the screen boundary.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.MoveCursorTo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the specified screen location.
member.remarks: If either row or column is out of screen bounds, the method moves the cursor but within the screen's dimensions.
member.param: Row position to move the cursor to.
Column position to move the cursor to.
member.returns: ReturnCode indicates sucess, failure, or a warning condition if the cursor position reaches the screen boundary.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.MoveCursorTo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the specified screen location.
member.returns: ReturnCode.Success if successful or ReturnCode.Error if unsucessful.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.ExtendSelection(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects all text in the terminal window between the selection start position and the specified coordinates.
member.param: The row in which the selection should end.
The column in which the selection should end.

remarks.para: Use the SetSelectionStartPos method to set the starting coordinates. (The default starting position is row 1, column 1.)
The ExtendSelection method selects the stream from the starting position coordinates to the extended position coordinates and returns a text selection shaped like this:
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

The ExtendSelectionRect method selects a rectangular block of text between the starting and ending row. The starting and the ending coordinate columns define the vertical edges of the block. The resulting block of text is shaped like this:
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
If the ending coordinates are smaller than the starting coordinates, the ExtendSelectionRect and ExtendSelection methods select text backwards (from right to left or bottom to top).
These methods do not return the selected area. To get the selected region and its properties, use the ScreenRegion object.

member.exception: This exception is thrown if the row or column parameters are outside the range of valid values: (1 to Rows) or (1 to Columns).

code.title: Select text area
code.description: This sample selects a text area when the screen is ready. It also gets the selected screen region.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.ExtendSelectionRect(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects a block of text in the terminal window that includes all rows between the starting row and the specified row.
member.param: The row in which the selection should end.
The column in which the selection should end.

remarks.para: Use the SetSelectionStartPos method to set the starting coordinates. (The default is row 1, column 1.)
The ExtendSelectionRect method returns a rectangular block of text between the starting and ending row, resulting in a block of text shaped like this:
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
The ExtendSelection method returns all text in the terminal window between the selection start position and the specified coordinates, resulting in a block of text shaped like this:
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
If the ending coordinates are smaller than the starting coordinates, the ExtendSelectionRect and ExtendSelection methods select text backwards (from right to left or bottom to top).
These methods select text but do not return the selected area. To get the selected region and its properties, use the ScreenRegion object.

member.exception: This exception is thrown if the row or column parameters are outside the range of valid values: (1 to Rows) or (1 to Columns).

code.title: Select a block of text
code.description: This sample selects a block of text when a new screen is ready. It also gets the selected screen region.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.BlanksBetweenFields
member.summary: Gets or specifies the number of consecutive blank spaces between columns of data that are required for the data to be tab delimited.
member.remarks:
This setting works in conjunction with the UseTableFormat property to determine where columns exist in tab-delimited information on the Clipboard.
The default value is 2. The range of values is 1 - 16.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter is outside the range of valid values.
This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.ClearSelectionOnCopy
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether text remains selected after it is copied to the Clipboard.
member.remarks: If this setting is enabled, the terminal automatically deselects text after it is copied to the Clipboard.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.CopyInputFieldsOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a copy (cut or append) operation puts values in unprotected input fields on the Clipboard.
member.remarks:
This property is useful for working with form-oriented host applications.
If this property is True and UseTableFormat is also True, Reflection is more likely to interpret text as containing columns, because there will be more spaces.

value.para: The default value is False.
If this property is True, the terminal replaces protected characters with spaces. If it is false, protected and unprotected characters are treated identically.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.CopyTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the terminal copies the character spaces that trail a selection when text is copied to the Clipboard.
member.remarks: When this property is true, the terminal includes trailing spaces in text copied to the Clipboard. When it is false, the terminal does not include them.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.CutFillCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether Cut and Clear actions replace characters with nulls or spaces.

remarks.para: The value of this property determines how data is transmitted to the host, but does not influence the current screen display. All cut or cleared characters appear as spaces in the current screen display.

member.value: For the default value (SpaceCharacter), cut and cleared characters are replaced with spaces.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.PasteReplaceTabs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to replace tabs in the Clipboard's contents with a specified string before pasting the selection within a host application.
member.remarks: The PasteTabReplacement property defines the string.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.PasteTabReplacement
member.summary: Gets or specifies the string that replaces tabs if the PasteReplaceTabs setting is set to true.
member.remarks: Any random set of characters is acceptable, including character spaces. The PasteReplaceTabs property must be set to true. The string can be up to 260 characters long.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the set parameter length exceeds the maximum allowed length.
This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.PasteUsingFieldDelimiters
member.summary: Returns or specifies what happens if the terminal reaches a protected field while pasting text in the following row at the same column location where the paste began.
member.remarks:
When the value is true, the terminal searches to the right and then down until it finds an unprotected field in which to paste text. If no unprotected fields are found, pasting stops and any remaining text is placed into the PasteNext buffer.
When the value is false, pasting stops, and any text remaining in the Clipboard is placed into the PasteNext buffer.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.PasteWrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether text that exceeds the current line length is pasted in the next field or truncated.
member.remarks: If this value is true, remaining text is pasted at the start of the next field. If it is false, the terminal truncates the current line and begins pasting at the next field with the beginning of a new line.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.PasteWrapDown
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether pasted text should be wrapped to the field below (instead of to the field to the right).
member.remarks: If this value is true, the text is wrapped to the field below the current field. If it is false, the text is wrapped to the next input field to the right.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you try to modify a property that has been secured with the Permissions Manager or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.CursorColumn
member.summary: Gets the cursor's column location relative to the left edge of the terminal window.
member.remarks: CursorRow returns the row location. The value of this property can be changed with the MoveCursor or MoveCursorTo methods as well as by keyboard and mouse actions.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmScreen.CursorRow
