member.summary: Defines options that specify the extent to which Reflection applies the logic for character insertion, as described for the terminal's InsertProtocol property.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertArenaOption.CurrentField
member.summary: No change is allowed to any field except the current field.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertArenaOption.LocalUnprotectedFields
member.summary: Changes are allowed to the current field and to other local unprotected fields. If two or more unprotected fields are contiguous (that is, not separated by any protected fields), they are local.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertArenaOption.AllUnprotectedFields
member.summary: Changes are allowed to all unprotected fields in the partition.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertProtocolOption
member.summary: Defines options that specify what Reflection does when users attempt to insert a character.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertProtocolOption.FirstNull
member.summary: Make room for the character being inserted by moving all characters to the right of the insertion point one character to the right until a null is encountered. The null is replaced by a character and all subsequent characters are unchanged. If a null is not found, the insertion fails.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertProtocolOption.FirstNullOrTrailingSpace
member.summary: Uses the same logic as FirstNull except that a trailing space can be used if a null is not found.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InsertProtocolOption.FirstNullOrTrailingChar
member.summary: Replaces the last character in the insert arena if neither a null nor a trailing space is found.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IPrintOptions.PrintFileExistsAction
member.summary: Returns or specifies what the terminal does when you send a print job to an existing file.
member.remarks:
This property is relevant only when the PrintToFile property is set to true. Use the PrintFileName property to specify the print file name.
Values:
AppendAdds the information to the end of the existing file.
AskUser Prompts the user to select an option. (The default.)
AutoNumberCreates a new file by adding an incremented number to the existing filename.
OpenErrorCauses the print job to fail and return an error.
OverwriteReplaces the existing file with the new information.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

members.member:
Returns or specifies the name of the file to receive print jobs when the PrintToFile property is set to true.
Use the PrintFileExistsAction to determine what happens when the specified file already exists. The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IPrintOptions.PrintToFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies the destination of the terminal print jobs.
member.remarks:
When this property is true, the terminal sends print jobs to a file. Use PrintFileName to specify the file name. Use PrintFileExistsAction to determine what happens if the specified file already exists.
When this property is false, the terminal sends print jobs to the printer. This property affects screen printing, 3270 printer sessions, and 5250 printer sessions.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IPrintOptions.PrintSosiPresentation
member.summary: Returns or specifies how the terminal treats shift-out and shift-in (SO/SI) characters when printing host print jobs or terminal screens. This property is applicable to 5250 sessions only.

item.description: Shift-out/shift-in (SO/SI) characters are printed as blank spaces. Use this option for WYSIWYG printing. (The default.)

SO/SI characters and the cells they occupy are removed, and the remaining text is collapsed. Removing cells that contain SO/SI characters changes the spacing of the text and can potentially cause columns to go out of alignment.

Shift Out (SO) characters are removed, double-byte characters are shifted one cell to the left, and SI characters are printed as two blank spaces. This option preserves the alignment of columns in host print jobs.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the cursor in the terminal window

member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the cursor blinks in the terminal window.
member.remarks: This is stored as a string in the theme.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.RulerCursorType

summary.para: Gets or sets the appearance of the ruler cursor.

member.remarks: Use the RulerCursorVisible property to specify whether the ruler cursor should be displayed.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.RulerCursorVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ruler cursor is displayed in the terminal window.
member.remarks: Use the RulerCursorType property to specify the configuration you want.

value.para: The default value is False.
When this property is True, horizontal or vertical lines extend through the cursor.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.GraphicsCursorShape
member.summary: Gets or stes the shape of the graphics cursor in 3179-G terminal sessions.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for 3270 display sessions.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.GraphicsCrosshairColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the graphics crosshair cursor in a 3179-G terminal session.
member.remarks: This is only valid for 3270 terminal sessions emulating the Extended terminal models.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.RestrictCursorMovement
member.summary:
Returns or specifies whether the cursor is restricted to input fields in the terminal window. When this property is set to True, the cursor can only be moved within or between input fields. If you press Up, for example, the cursor moves up to the next input field. When this property is False, the cursor can be moved out of an input field. Trying to enter text outside of an input field results in an error.
This property is only relevant for 5250 terminal sessions.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.HorizontalCursorSpeed
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many character spaces to move the cursor, either to the left (on LeftDouble function), or to the right (on a RightDouble function). This property affects 5250 terminal sessions.
member.remarks: The default is 3. The range of values is 1-40.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor.VerticalCursorSpeed
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many lines to move the cursor, either up (on an UpDouble function), or down (on a DownDouble function). function). This property affects 5250 terminal sessions.
member.remarks: The default is 2. The range of values is 1-12.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont
member.summary: Defines the font attributes (such as font name, font size) for terminal fonts within a Reflection theme.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object. The parent is the ITheme object.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the face name of the terminal font to use.

remarks.para: Available fonts are listed in the Fonts list on the Appearance tab. Font names are case-sensitive.

By default, Reflection uses the font called Segoe UI Mono. This provides a 24 80 display that accurately emulates the terminal. When you resize the terminal window, by default (for any font) Reflection chooses a new font size so the correct number of rows is displayed on the screen.

member.value:
The default is "Segoe UI Mono".
This string can be up to 260 characters long.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont.Bold
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the terminal font has the bold attribute.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont.DisplayVariableWidthFonts
member.summary: whether variable width fonts are included in the list of fonts that appears in the Fonts section of the Theme Settings

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont.AutoFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether font size is auto adjusted when terminal window size changed.

value.para: The default value is True.

When this property is True, Reflection automatically adjusts the font size so that the entire terminal display is always visible.
When this property is False, Reflection uses the font size specified by FontSize. Scroll bars appear when the Reflection window size is too small to show the entire terminal window display.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeFont.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the terminal session font in points
member.remarks: This property has no effect when AutoFontSize is True (the default).

value.para: The default value is 12.

The range of values is 3 to 72. If you select a value within this range that is not supported by the current font, Reflection substitutes a similar font size. Values outside this range return an error.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeepAlivePacketsOption
member.summary: Defines options that specify how Reflection periodically polls the host to determine if Telnet connections remain active during intervals when data is not sent to the host.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeepAlivePacketsOption.KeepAliveNone
member.summary: No keep alive packets are sent to the host.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeepAlivePacketsOption.KeepAliveSystem
member.summary: The TCP/IP stack keeps track of the host connection. This value requires less system resources than KeepAliveTimingMark or KeepAliveNOP, but most TCP/IP stacks send Keep Alive packets infrequently.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeepAlivePacketsOption.KeepAliveNOP
member.summary: A No Operation (NOP) command is periodically sent to the host. The gateway and host are not required to respond to these commands, but the TCP/IP stack can detect if there was a problem delivering the packet. Use KeepAliveTimeout to control the interval between requests.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeepAlivePacketsOption.KeepAliveTimingMark
member.summary: A Timing Mark Command is periodically sent to the host to determine if the connection is still active. The gateway or host should respond to these commands. If Reflection does not receive a response or there is an error sending the packet, it shuts down the connection. Use KeepAliveTimeout to control the interval between requests.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardErrorResetOption
member.summary: Defines options that specify how keyboard errors are processed.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardErrorResetOption.NoAutoReset
member.summary: This is standard terminal behavior. Users must press Reset to clear the error message from the 5250 error line before they can resume data entry.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardErrorResetOption.AutoReset
member.summary: Users do not need to press Reset to clear a keyboard error. The next key they press clears the error, restores the previous error line data, and attempts to execute the keystroke.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardErrorResetOption.AutoResetNoMessage
member.summary: No error is reported and Reflection attempts to execute the keystroke.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper
member.summary: Provides the ability to view keyboard mappings for the terminal session, and to remap keys programmatically.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.#ctor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IKeyboardMapper,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IIbmTerminal)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.AddMapping(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping)
member.summary: Adds a key mapping to the current keyboard map.
member.param: A mapping between a key sequence and a set of actions to perform when that key sequence is pressed in a host session.
member.remarks: A key can also be remapped to do nothing if the InputMapActionSequence specified in mapping.Mapping has no InputMapActions added to it.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.RemoveMapping(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Removes a key mapping from the keyboard map.
member.remarks: Use this method only to remove non-extended keys.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.RemoveMapping(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a key mapping from the keyboard map.
member.param: The key sequence to remove the mapping for.

Indicates whether this key is an extended key. For IBM Enhanced 101- and 102-key keyboards, extended keys are the right ALT and the right CTRL keys on the main keyboard; the INS, DEL, HOME, END, PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, and arrow keys to the left of the numeric keypad; and the slash (/) and ENTER keys in the numeric keypad.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.Contains(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Returns whether the current keyboard map has a mapping for a specified key combination.
member.remarks: This method only works for non-extended keys.
member.param: The key sequence to query for.
member.returns: True if the current keyboard map contains a mapping for key, false if not.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.Contains(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns whether the current keyboard map has a mapping for a specified key combination.
member.param: The key sequence to query for.

Indicates whether this key is an extended key. For IBM Enhanced 101- and 102-key keyboards, extended keys are the right ALT and the right CTRL keys on the main keyboard; the INS, DEL, HOME, END, PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, and arrow keys to the left of the numeric keypad; and the slash (/) and ENTER keys in the numeric keypad.
member.returns: True if the current keyboard map contains a mapping for key, false if not.

The caller does not have the required permission to save the keyboard map.

member.summary: Gets the parent object (IIbmTerminal).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapper.KeyMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the keymap file.
member.remarks:
When setting the filename, if the value is not a full path, Reflection searches the user's Reflection data folder and the Built-Ins/Keyboard Maps folder.
If the file cannot be found there, or the full path passed in does not exist, a FileNotFoundException is thrown.

The name of the saved macro. This parameter is ignored if saveLocation is Clipboard.
member.exception: Thrown if the macro name is null, empty, or contains invalid characters.

member.summary: Gets a list of existing macro names.

member.summary: Runs a macro.
member.param: The location of the macro. MacroEnumerationOption.Document indicates that the macro resides in the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.Common indicates that the macro resides in the Common VBA project.
The name of the macro to run.

example.code:
private Macro mac;
mac.RunMacro(MacroEnumerationOption.Document,"Module1.Macro1");

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Macro.RunMacro(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.MacroEnumerationOption,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a macro.
member.param: The location of the macro. MacroEnumerationOption.Document indicates that the macro resides in the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.Common indicates that the macro resides in the Common VBA project.
The name of the macro to run.
Parameter to pass to the macro.

example.code:
private Macro mac;
mac.RunMacro(MacroEnumerationOption.Document,"Module1.Macro1","Data1");

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Macro.RunMacro(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.MacroEnumerationOption,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Runs a macro.
member.param: The location of the macro. MacroEnumerationOption.Document indicates that the macro resides in the session document's VBA project. MacroEnumerationOption.Common indicates that the macro resides in the Common VBA project.

Parameters to pass to the macro.

example.code:
private Macro mac;
mac.RunMacro(MacroEnumerationOption.Document,"Module1.Macro1",new object[]{"Data1","Data2"});

member.summary: Runs a legacy Reflection macro from an external file (that is, a file that is not currently in use).

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Macro.RunLegacyReflectionMacro(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a legacy Reflection macro.
member.param: Specifies the name of the macro to run. An error occurs if there is no macro of this name in the current settings file or in any referenced files. This value can be up to 255 characters long. If you have more than one macro with the same name in different files, precede the macro name with the project name and a period to correctly identify the macro. For example, "SharedMacros.Login" identifies the "Login" macro in the "SharedMacros" settings file.
An optional string to pass information to the macro.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the mouse map file.

member.summary: Returns or specifies the width of the form to print to when the PrintFitUser property is true.
member.remarks: The value is expressed in percent reduction (less than 100%) or expansion (greater than 100%). The default value is 100. The range of values is 10 - 1000.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrinterOrientation
member.summary: Returns or specifies the default page orientation used to print host documents.

item.description: Uses the page orientation sent down from the host to print the document.
Forces the page orientation to landscape mode (11" x 8.5"), regardless of how the document is configured on the host.
Forces the page orientation to portrait mode (8.5" x 11"), regardless of how the document is configured on the host.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrinterOrientation = PrinterOrientationOption.Portrait;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintCharsPerLine
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of characters that can be printed on a single line.
member.remarks: If a line longer than this is passed down from the host, the terminal automatically wraps the line. This property affects all printing operations. Any number between 1 and 32,767; the range of legal values and the default are determined by your printer driver.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintFileExistsAction
member.summary: Returns or specifies what the terminal does when you send a print job to an existing file. This property is relevant only when the PrintToFile property is set to true. Use the PrintFileName property to specify the print file name.

item.description: Adds the information to the end of the existing file.
Prompts the user to select an option. (The default.)
Creates a new file by adding an incremented number to the existing filename.
Causes the print job to fail and return an error.
Replaces the existing file with the new information.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintFileExistsAction = PrintFileExistsActionOption.AutoNumber;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintFileName
member.summary: Returns or specifies the name of the file to receive print jobs when the PrintToFile property is set to true. Use the PrintFileExistsAction to determine what happens when the specified file already exists.
member.remarks: The default value is "". This string can be up to 260 characters long.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.
Thrown if the set parameter is null (Nothing in Visual Basic). Use an zero-length string to indicate an empty value.
Thrown if the set parameter length is too long.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintFileName = "FilePrint";

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintToFile
member.summary: Returns or specifies the destination of the terminal print jobs.
member.remarks: When this property is true, the terminal sends print jobs to a file. Use PrintFileName to specify the filename. Use PrintFileExistsAction to determine what happens if the specified file already exists. When this property is false, the terminal sends print jobs to the printer. This property affects screen printing, 3270 printer sessions, and 5250 printer sessions.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintToFile = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintCharsPerInch
member.summary: Specifies how many characters to print per inch.
member.remarks:
If the PrintProportionalCPI property is set to true, PrintCharsPerInch is disregarded. In this case, the number of characters printed per inch is determined by the current printer font.
Values:
cpi5Prints 5 characters per inch.
cpi6Prints 6 characters per inch.
cpi8Prints 8 characters per inch.
cpi10Prints 10 characters per inch. (The default.)
cpi12Prints 12 characters per inch.
cpi13Prints 13 characters per inch.
cpi15Prints 15 characters per inch.
cpi17Prints 17 characters per inch.
cpi20Prints 20 characters per inch.
cpi22Prints 22 characters per inch.
cpi27Prints 27 characters per inch.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintCharsPerInch = PrintCharsPerInchOption.Cpi10;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintCompressFont
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether composed Thai characters are vertically compressed while printing to make them more legible.
member.remarks: This setting applies only to Thai language versions of the terminal.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintCompressFont = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintDbcs2To3
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether to widen double-byte characters to 1.5 times their default size when printing host print jobs and terminal screens to make them more legible.
member.remarks: When this property is true, the terminal widens double-byte characters so that two characters occupy the same number of spaces as three single-byte characters.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintDbcs2To3 = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintDbcsHorzFontSize
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the terminal doubles the horizontal size of double-byte characters when it prints host screens or print jobs to make them more legible.

item.description: Uses the default size.
Doubles the horizontal size of characters.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintDbcsHorzFontSize = PrintDbcsHorzFontSizeOption.Print1x;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintDbcsRotationAngle
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether to rotate characters 270 degrees when printing host print jobs or terminal screens.
member.remarks:
Rotating characters 270 degrees presents host print jobs that contain double-byte characters in a traditional, top-to-bottom, left-to-right alignment. This setting is applicable to double-byte character sets only.
Values:
PrintRotate0Does not rotate characters. (The default.)
PrintRotate270 Rotates characters 270 degrees.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintDbcsRotationAngle = PrintDbcsRotationAngleOption.PrintRotate270;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintDbcsSmallerFont
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether to print double-byte characters using a smaller font size.
member.remarks: When this property is false, the font size is normal. When it is true, the terminal uses a smaller font size. This property applies to 5250 sessions only.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintDbcsSmallerFont = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintFormFeedOnEndOfJob
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the terminal sends a form feed to the host printer at the end of print jobs.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintFormFeedOnEndOfJob = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintSosiPresentation
member.summary: Returns or specifies how the terminal treats shift-out and shift-in (SO/SI) characters when printing host print jobs or terminal screens.This property is applicable to 5250 sessions only.

item.description: Shift-out/shift-in (SO/SI) characters are printed as blank spaces. Use this option for WYSIWYG printing. (The default.)

SO/SI characters and the cells they occupy are removed, and the remaining text is collapsed. Removing cells that contain SO/SI characters changes the spacing of the text and can potentially cause columns to go out of alignment.

Shift Out (SO) characters are removed, double-byte characters are shifted one cell to the left, and SI characters are printed as two blank spaces. This option preserves the alignment of columns in host print jobs.

member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintSosiPresentation = PrintSosiPresentOption.SoNoPosS12Pos;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintSquareAspectRatio
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the terminal preserves the dimensions of the graphics display when it prints, ensuring that objects maintain their correct proportions and shapes.
member.remarks: This setting is valid in 3179G terminal sessions only. It has no effect when FastTextPrinting property is true.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintSquareAspectRatio = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintOptions.PrintSuppressBlankPage
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether blank pages are suppressed.
member.remarks: When this property is true, the terminal suppresses blank pages on host print jobs. When it is false, the terminal does not suppress blank pages.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when you modify a property that was secured via the Permissions Manager, or that can only be modified by an Administrator.

example.code:
private PrintOptions option;
option.PrintSuppressBlankpage = true;

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintScreenOption.PrintPartition
member.summary: Prints the current host partition. This value is relevant only when the session type is 3270 terminal.

member.summary: Prints the terminal window contents.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintScreenOption.PrintScreenOrSel
member.summary: Prints selected text or, if no text is selected, the terminal window contents.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.PrintScreenOption.PrintSel
member.summary: Prints selected text or, if no text is selected, prints nothing.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping
member.summary: Maps a key to a sequence of one or more input actions.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the KeyboardMapping class.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InputMapActionSequence)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the KeyboardMapping class.
member.param: Optional parameters associated with the action. If there are no parameters needed for the action, null may be specified for this parameter.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Keys,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.InputMapActionSequence,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Optional parameters associated with the action. If there are no parameters needed for the action, null may be specified for this parameter.

Indicates whether this key is an extended key. For IBM Enhanced 101- and 102-key keyboards, extended keys are the right ALT and the right CTRL keys on the main keyboard; the INS, DEL, HOME, END, PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, and arrow keys to the left of the numeric keypad; and the slash (/) and ENTER keys in the numeric keypad.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping.GetSchema
member.summary: Returns an in-memory representation of the XML schema used for SerializableList
member.returns: Null -- not currently implemented.

member.summary: Reads in a list type from an xml file
member.param: where to read the xml from

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.KeyboardMapping.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes out a list to xml format
member.param: writes the xml to persistant storage

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.TextBlinkRateOption
member.summary: Defines values that specify the blink rate for text displayed in the terminal window.
member.remarks: This applies only when the host has set a blinking attribute on the text displayed in the terminal window. This property applies to 3270 and 5250 terminal sessions.

member.summary: The blinking attribute is ignored.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.TextBlinkRateOption.Slow
member.summary: Text blinks once every second.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.TextBlinkRateOption.Fast

member.summary: Compares text using a regular expression.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.TextComparisonOption.IgnoreCase

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.TextComparisonOption.MatchCase

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme
member.summary: Theme object represents a visual theme in the application.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a new theme into the current session document.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme.Save
member.summary: Saves changes to the current theme.
member.exception: An I/O (input/output) error occurred while trying to save the theme.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the theme.

member.summary: Saves the current theme contents to a file.
member.param: The path to the new theme.
member.exception: An I/O error occurred while trying to save the theme.
The caller does not have the required permission to save the theme.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme.ResetTheme
member.summary: Abandons any changes made in the "dirty" state and applies the last saved settings.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object. The parent is the IIbmTerminal object.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme.FileName
member.summary: Gets the theme template to use. The Set action for this property is Obsolete and will be removed in a future release. Use the Theme object's method instead.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.Theme.Modified
member.summary: Returns the modified state of the theme.
member.remarks: True indicates that the theme has been modified since the last save, false indicates that it has not been modified.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.#ctor(Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.IThemeCursor,Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ITheme)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent object. The parent is the ITheme object.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.CursorShape
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the cursor in the terminal window.

remarks.para: This is stored as a string in the theme.
Values:
FullBlock (the default)
HighHalfBlock
LowHalfBlock
NoCursor
Underline

code.title: Set the cursor shape
code.description: This statement sets the cursor to appear as a rectangle that covers the bottom half of the character space.

example.code:
private ThemeCursor cursor;
cursor.CursorShape = CursorShapeOption.LowHalfCursor;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.CursorBlinkRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the cursor blinks in the terminal window.
member.remarks:
This is stored as a string in the theme.
Values:
Fast
Medium
NoBlink
Slow
System

code.title: Set the cursor blink rate
code.description: This statement sets the cursor blink rate to slow.

example.code: private ThemeCursor cursor; cursor.CursorBlinkRate = CursorBlinkingRateOption.Slow;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.RulerCursorVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ruler cursor is visible.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.GraphicsCursorShape
member.summary: Gets or Sets the shape of the graphics cursor in 3179G terminal sessions.
member.remarks:
This property is only valid for 3270 display sessions.
Values:
ColorCrosshair
Cross
InvertedCrosshair

example.code:
private ThemeCursor cursor;
cursor.GraphicsCursorShape = GraphicsCursorShapeOption.InvertedCrosshair;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.GraphicsCrosshairColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the graphics cross hair cursor in a 3179G terminal session.
member.remarks:
This is only valid for 3270 terminal sessions that emulate the Extended terminal models.
The values include Black, Blue, Cyan, darkBlue, DarkCyan, DarkGreen, DarkGray, DarkMagenta, DarkRed, DarkYellow, Green, Gray, Magenta, Red, White, and Yellow.

example.code:
private ThemeCursor cursor;
cursor.GraphicsCrosshairColor = GraphicsCrossHairColorOption.DarkGrey;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.RestrictCursorMovement
member.summary: Returns or specifies whether the cursor is restricted to input fields in the terminal window.
member.remarks:
When this property is set to true, the cursor can only be moved within or between input fields. If you press Up, for example, the cursor moves up to the next input field.
When this property is set to false, the cursor can be moved out of an input field. Trying to enter text outside of an input field results in an error.
This property is only relevant for 5250 terminal sessions.

example.code:
private ThemeCursor cursor;
cursor.RestrictCursorMovement = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.HorizontalCursorSpeed
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many character spaces to move the cursor, either to the left (on Left Double function), or to the right (on a Right Double function).
member.remarks: This property affects 5250 terminal sessions. The default is 3. The range of values is 1 - 40.

example.code:
private ThemeCursor cursor;
cursor.HorizontalCursorSpeed = 30;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeCursor.VerticalCursorSpeed
member.summary: Returns or specifies how many lines to move the cursor, either up(on an Up Double function), or down (on a Down Double function).
member.remarks: This property affects 5250 terminal sessions. The default is 2. The range of values is 1 - 12.

example.code:
private ThemeCursor cursor;
cursor.VerticalCursorSpeed = 10;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeFont.DisplayVariableWidthFonts
member.summary: Determines whether variable width fonts are included in the list of fonts that appears in the Fonts section of the Theme Settings.
member.remarks: The default value is True.

code.title: Set to display variable width fonts
code.description: The following statement turns on the display of variable width fonts.

example.code: private ThemeFont themeFont; themeFont.DisplayVariableWidthFonts = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeFont.AutoFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether font size auto adjusts when the terminal window size changes.

example.code:

themeFont.AutoFontSize = true;

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.Emulation.IbmHosts.ThemeFont.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size (in points) of the terminal session font.

example.code:

int size = themeFont.FontSize;
